page.title: 11Cockfield Fell.
page.content: Cockfield Fell has an area of 820 acres.It is hilly,rough ground and dates back thousands of years,before the village in fact.It was probably because of The Fell that Cockfield was built in the first place.Coal was taken off The Fell in 1375.When people stopped moving coal from The Fell they left large piles of coal waste which a firm is are now trying to reclaim.There is an old quarry on The Fell where whinstone used to be extracted.The houses on The Fell were originally built for the quarrymen.The quarry is now being filled up as it is dangerous. There is still evidence of the disused railway,part of the Barnard Castle to Bishop Auckland line which used to run across The Fell.The Fell contains relics of many ages,but also has awide present usage.
